chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly A Nerge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered. Court costs are paid in full on this count.
---------------------------

No contact with the victim police officers. No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
---------------------------

timeConds.notes:
with work release privileges.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to the OWI 2nd in Case No. 2014CT000030.
The defendant is to complete ninety (90) hours of community service work during her period of probation with NO BUYOUT.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain either full time employment or school or a combination of the two.
-------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
-------------------------------

Undergo any counseling as recommended. Attend parenting classes or whatever the Agent deems appropriate to address any parenting needs she sees.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
-------------------------------
Comply with mental health treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kelly A Nerge
Current: PO Box 3100, c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution, Fond du Lac, WI 54936 United States  (Effective: 05-24-2017)
Prior: N2446 Sheldon St., Darien, WI 53114 United States

Sentencing After Revocation Hearing before the Hon. Kristine E. Drettwan on September 8, 2016
Court reporter: Sandra Elderbrook
Temporary Commitment form filed

3:01 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kelly A Nerge in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  
Matter is before the court for a sentencing after revocation hearing.  The Court has reviewed the revocation summary and Ms. Nerge's file.  Judge Drettwan is familiar with this matter because she did handle the CHIPS matter.  The parties state that they do not have an agreement.  Court recites charges and maximum potential penalties. Atty Necci makes record with regard to victim notification requirements.  
Atty Anderson makes record with regard to the documents that she has reviewed with Ms. Nerge.  
3:04 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Necci.  
3:09 pm  Atty Anderson indicates that there are family members present in Court who may wish to speak. 
3:10 pm  Cynthia L. Nerge, deft's mother, makes statement on her daughter's behalf.  
3:14 pm  Kevin Nerge, deft's father, makes statement on his daughter's behalf.  
3:17 pm  Response by Mr. Nerge to Atty Anderson's questions.  
3:19 pm  Mrs. Cynthia Nerge makes a further statement.  
3:21 pm  Response by Mrs. Nerge to Atty Anderson's questions.  
3:22 pm  Lisa Christenson makes statement on behalf of defendant.  
3:23 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Anderson.  
3:32 pm  Statement by Defendant.  
3:36 pm  Response by Deft to Court's questions.  
3:38 pm  Further statement by Defendant.  
3:40 pm  Court makes record and proceeds with sentencing the Defendant.  

SENTENCE:
Ct 1:  Total length of sentence is 3 yrs, 6 mths
18 months IC followed by 2 years ES
Ct 2:  Total length of sentence is 3 yrs, 6 mths
18 months IC followed by 2 years ES, consecutive to Ct 1
470 days of sentence credit

CONDITIONS OF ES:
1)  No alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
2)  No weapons.  
3)  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.  
4)  Undergo any counseling as recommended.  
5)  Comply with mental health treatment.  
6)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
7)  Maintain either full time employment or school or a combination of the two.  
8)  Attend parenting classes or whatever the Agent deems appropriate to address any parenting needs she sees.  

Deft is NOT eligible for CIP or SAP
Court gives deft warnings with regard to:  Firearms restriction; voting ineligibility and prohibition from possessing body armor.  
4:01 pm  Court in recess.
**Transcript filed on 12-16-2016**  (ls)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Violation/Revocation Summary.
